original: LINDGREN, Carl Birger, Fil Doktor, Stockholm, f Nysätra, Vbott l, 4/3 78 av apot C G L o Edla Edenquist, gm Karin Adler. Studex NLatin 96, civ.ing KTH 99, fil lic Upps 03, disp 03, promov fil dr Upps 04. Anst Riks-försäkr.anst 05—06, El prövningsanst Sthlm 07—08, KTH:s rntrlprovn.anst 08—15, byrådir Patentvkt 15—31, byråch o led besvärsavd där 31—43. K m :ts uppdr utf utredn inom ålders-o inval.försäkr 06, Sv omb v int konf f ind rättsskydd London 34, föreläsn HHS i ind org 10—11. Styr.led AB Keros sed. 16, Northern Agencies AB sed. 43, AB Kristinehamns elvk 12—26, dir.led Ryska AB LUX 17—18 o Sv frn f ind rättsskydd sed. 33. Studie- o aff.res i de fi europ länd 04—35, aff.res Ryssl 15—29, Egypt 34. Av trycket: »Sur la fonc-tion entiére eK(z)+K,(z)» VA:s handl (02)„ »Sur le cas d’exeption de M. Picard dans la théorie des fonctions entriéres» Upps (03),, upps i Ekon tidskr, Sv Elvksfrns årsb, Meddel fr Tekn Högsk mtrlprovn.anst, Ind.tidn Norden, Nord ind rättsskydd, Tekn tidskr, Pä-tentvkts minnesskr 41. KNO2kl, RVO. Hobby : Gammal konst.
translated: LINDGREN, Carl Birger, PhD, Stockholm, b. in Nysätra, Västerbotten county, on March 4th, 1878, son of pharmacist C G L Lindgren and Edla Edenquist, married to Karin Adler. Studied Latin at NLatin 96, graduated as an engineer from KTH in 1899, obtained a licentiate degree from Uppsala University in 1903, defended his PhD dissertation at Uppsala in 1904. Employed at the National Insurance Agency from 1905 to 1906, at the Electrical Testing Agency in Stockholm from 1907 to 1908, at KTH's central testing agency from 1908 to 1915, as a senior official at the Patent Office from 1915 to 1931, as head of the Appeals Department from 1931 to 1943. Appointed by the government to carry out investigations in the field of retirement and disability insurance in 1906, Swedish representative in international conference for industrial protection of intellectual property rights in London in 1934, gave lectures on industrial organization at the Stockholm School of Economics in 1910 and 1911. Board member of AB Keros since 1916, Northern Agencies AB since 1943, and AB Kristinehamns electricity company from 1912 to 1926, director and board member of Russian AB LUX from 1917 to 1918 and Swedish representative in international conference for industrial protection of intellectual property rights since 1933. Conducted study and business trips to various European countries from 1904 to 1935, business trips to Russia from 1915 to 1929, Egypt in 1934. Published works: "Sur la fonc-tion entiére eK(z)+K,(z)" in VA's transactions (1902), "Sur le cas d’exeption de M. Picard dans la théorie des fonctions entriéres" in Uppsala bulletin (1903), articles in the Journal of Economics, Swedish Electricity Company's yearbook, Communications from the Technical Testing Agency, Industrial journal for the Nordic countries, Nordic industrial protection, Technical journal, Patent Office's memorial book (1941). Knight of the Royal Order of the North Star (2nd class), Royal Order of Vasa. Hobby: Old art.
